{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox monarchy | border = provincial | royal_title = Sultan | realm = Selangor | type = other3 | coatofarms = | coatofarms_article = Flags of Malaysia | image = | incumbent = [[Sharafuddin of Selangor|Sharafuddin]] | other = | his/her = His Royal | heir_apparent = | first_monarch = [[Raja Lumu|Salahuddin Shah]] | date = [[1745]] }} [[Image:Sultan-klang.jpg|thumb|right|300px|The palace of the Sultan of Selangor in Klang]] [[Image:National Museum KL 2008 (116).JPG|thumb|Headgear of Sultan of Selangor]]
'''Sultan of Selangor''' is the title of the constitutional ruler of [[Selangor]], [[Malaysia]].
==Bugis bloodline== The Sultans of Selangor are descended from a [[Bugis]] dynasty that claim descent from the rulers of [[Luwu]] in the [[South Sulawesi|southern part of Celebes]] (today known as [[Sulawesi]]). Nobles from this bloodline were involved in the dispute over the Johor-Riau Sultanate in the early 18th century, eventually placing their full support in the cause of Sultan Abdul Jalil of the Bendahara dynasty against the claimant to the Malaccan lineage, Raja Kechil. For this reason, the [[Sultan of Johor|Bendahara rulers]] of Johor-Riau established close relations with the Bugis nobles, providing them with titles and control over many areas within the empire, including Selangor. Daeng Chelak's prince, [[Raja Lumu]] arrived in Selangor and founded a new government at [[Kuala Selangor]] in [[1766]]. He was installed by the [[Sultan of Perak]] as ''Sultan Salehuddin Shah'' and became the first Sultan of [[Selangor]].
==List of Sultans of Selangor== * '''[[Raja Lumu|Sultan Salahuddin Shah]]''' ([[Raja Lumu]]; 1745-1778) * '''[[Sultan Ibrahim Shah]]''' (Raja Ibrahim; 1778-1826) * '''[[Sultan Muhammad Shah]]''' (Raja Muhammad; 1826-1857) * '''[[Sultan Abdul Samad|Sultan Sir Abdul Samad]]''' (Raja Abdul Samad; 1857-1896) * '''[[Sultan Sulaiman|Sultan Sir Alaeddin Sulaiman Shah]]''' (Tengku Sulaiman Shah; 1896-1937) * '''[[Sultan Hisamuddin Alam Shah|Sultan Sir Hisamuddin Alam Shah Al-Haj]]''' (Tengku Alam Shah; 1937-1942, 1945-1960) * '''[[Sultan Musa Ghiatuddin Riayat Shah]]''' (Tengku Musaeddin; during Japanese occupation 1942-1945) * '''[[Sultan Salahuddin|Sultan Salahuddin Abdul Aziz Shah Al-Haj]]''' (Tengku Abdul Aziz Shah; 1960-2001) * '''[[Sharafuddin of Selangor|Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah Al-Haj]]''' (Tengku Idris Shah; 2001-current)
